tit.e: Fudokoku (rice tax stored in a warehouse called fudoso)
Fudokoku (rice tax stored in a warehouse called fudoso)

sen.j: 不動穀（ふどうこく）とは、律令制において令制国に置かれた不動倉に保管された稲穀のこと。
sen.e: Fudokoku is rice in the husk kept by fudoso (a warehouse which is sealed after the content of the regular warehouse became full) put in provinces in the ritsuryo system.

Fudokoku is rice in the husk kept in fudoso (a warehouse which was sealed after the regular warehouse became full) put in provinces in the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
sen.cmt: "kept by"→"kept in"に修正。"became full"の主語は"content"ではなく"warehouse"だと思います。"ritsuryo system"に説明を追記しました。
sen.e: Fudokoku is rice in the husk kept in fudoso (a warehouse which was sealed after the regular warehouse became full) put in provinces in the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、粟で代用された不動粟穀（ふどうあわこく）や酒の形で保管された不動酒（ふどうしゅ）も不動穀の一種である。
sen.e: In addition, fudo awakoku (foxtail millet in husk in a warehouse which is sealed after the content of a regular warehouse became full) and fudoshu (grain kept in a form of liquor in a warehouse which is sealed after the content of a regular warehouse became full) are variety of fudokoku; in this case the foxtail millet is a substitute for rise in husk.

In addition, fudo awakoku (foxtail millet in husk stored in fudoso) and fudoshu (grain kept in a form of liquor stored in fudoso) are varieties of fudokoku; in this case the foxtail millet is a substitute for rice in husk.
sen.cmt: 不動粟穀・不動酒の説明、"in a warehouse"以下は、簡潔に"stored in fudoso"で良いと思います。（すでに不動倉は説明済み）"variety"を複数形に修正。"rise"は"rice"のスペルミス。
sen.e: In addition, fudo awakoku (foxtail millet in husk stored in fudoso) and fudoshu (grain kept in a form of liquor stored in fudoso) are varieties of fudokoku; in this case the foxtail millet is a substitute for rice in husk.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 和銅元年8月10日_(旧暦)の太政官符で、正税である稲穀の貯蔵と不動倉設置が奨励され、国衙・郡衙に設置された正倉に貯蔵され、それが満載となると、国司・郡司による検封作業を経て封印されて不動倉とされると、その中に入った稲穀は不動穀とされた。
sen.e: On the 10th of August of the first year of Wado (old calendar), storage of rice in the husk, which is shozei (rice tax),and putting in the fudoso (a warehouse which is sealed after the content of the regular warehouse became full) were encouraged in the official documents of the Daijokan, Grand Council of State; afterwards, rice in the husk was stored in the warehouse which was placed in the provincial government office compounds; when the warehouse became full, the provincial governor and the local officer examined the degree of sealing; after the sealing was completed, the warehouse was made fudoso and the rice in the husk kept in the fudoso was made fudokoku.

On September 2, 708, the storage of rice in the husk, which was shozei (rice tax), and putting it in fudoso were encouraged in the official documents of the Daijokan, Grand Council of State; afterwards, rice in the husk was stored in shoso (warehouse placed in the provincial government office compounds); when the warehouse became full, the provincial governor and the local officer examined and sealed it; after the sealing was completed, the warehouse was made fudoso and the rice in the husk kept in the fudoso was made fudokoku.
sen.cmt: 「和銅元年8月10日」→西暦708年9月2日"putting in"→putは他動詞なので、目的語itを挿入。「正倉」→正税とともに後で何度か出てくるので、ここで定義しておいた方が分かりやすいと思います。「不動倉」は説明済みなので（）内は不要。「検封作業を経て」→訳文だと「封印の具合を検査する」意味にとれますが、「検査して封印する」意味だと思います。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%A4%9C%E5%B0%81）
sen.e: On September 2, 708, the storage of rice in the husk, which was shozei (rice tax), and putting it in fudoso were encouraged in the official documents of the Daijokan, Grand Council of State; afterwards, rice in the husk was stored in shoso (warehouse placed in the provincial government office compounds); when the warehouse became full, the provincial governor and the local officer examined and sealed it; after the sealing was completed, the warehouse was made fudoso and the rice in the husk kept in the fudoso was made fudokoku.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 不動倉の鑰は都の太政官に進上されて、太政官で厳重に保管された。
sen.e: The key of fudoso (a warehouse which is sealed after the content of the regular warehouse became full) was presented to Daijokan (Grand Council of State) of the capital, and it was carefully kept by Daijokan.
The key of fudoso was presented to Daijokan of the capital, and it was carefully kept by Daijokan.
sen.cmt: 「不動倉」「太政官」は説明済みなので（）内は不要。
sen.e: The key of fudoso was presented to Daijokan of the capital, and it was carefully kept by Daijokan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 飢饉の際の賑給などの非常時に限って、令制国が不動倉開検申請解と呼ばれる解_(公文書)を太政官に提出して許可を求め、不動開用符または不動充符と呼ばれる太政官符の交付とともに鑰の返送を得ることで例外的に開封が認められた。
sen.e: In principle, opening of the fudoso was not permitted except the time of emergency like famine in which foods must be given to the needy; in such a time the local governor must submit an official document called fudoso kaiken shinseikai to Daijokan (Grand Council of State) and if he gets a permission along with the official document called fudokai yofu or fudo jufu, he was able to get the key to open the fudoso.

In principle, opening of the fudoso was not permitted except the time of emergency like famine in which foods must be given to the needy; in such a time the local governor must submit an official document called fudoso kaiken shinseige to Daijokan and if he got a permission along with the official document called fudokaiyofu or fudojufu, he was able to get the key to open the fudoso.
sen.cmt: 「不動倉開検申請解」→最後の「解」は「げ」と読むようです。（http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110002369240）「太政官」は説明済みなので（）内は不要。「不動開用符」「不動充符」→"fudokai yofu"と訳されていますが、私が調べた限りでは「用符」という単語が見つかりませんでした。「不動倉を開けて用いるための符」だとしたら、"fudo kaiyo fu"かもしれません。はっきりしないので、ここはスペースを入れない方が良いと思います。「不動充符」も同様。
sen.e: In principle, opening of the fudoso was not permitted except the time of emergency like famine in which foods must be given to the needy; in such a time the local governor must submit an official document called fudoso kaiken shinseige to Daijokan and if he got a permission along with the official document called fudokaiyofu or fudojufu, he was able to get the key to open the fudoso.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: こうした厳重な管理体制が約30年近く後天平年間田租収入の30年分余りの（田地からの年間収穫量とほぼ同一）の貯蔵が存在していたことが現存する各令制国の正税帳から推測できる。
sen.e: From the existing records on rice tax in various provinces, it can be thought that the strict management system continued for nearly 30 years during the Tenpyo era; and the amount stored in fudoso seemed to correspond with the income from the rice tax of more than 30 years (about the same as the yearly crop yields).

From the existing records on rice tax in various provinces, it can be thought that after continuing such strict management system for nearly 30 years, the amount stored in fudoso corresponded with more than 30 years' rice tax income in the Tenpyo era (almost the same as the yearly crop yields).
sen.cmt: 原文が分かりにくいですが、天平は729-749の20年間。ふたつ後の文で天平12年に制度が変わった旨の記載があることから、ここは「天平の間、30年間制度が続いた」ではなく、「制度が30年間続いた後、元号が天平になり、その田租収入の30年分以上の貯蔵があった」だと思います。
sen.e: From the existing records on rice tax in various provinces, it can be thought that after continuing such strict management system for nearly 30 years, the amount stored in fudoso corresponded with more than 30 years' rice tax income in the Tenpyo era (almost the same as the yearly crop yields).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ところが、倉庫令では倉庫内の穀は一定期間（最長で9年）ごとに中身を入れ替えて腐敗を防止する規定があるにも関わらず、不動倉の封印が厳重であったために、封印後は放置された状況となり、各地の不動倉で不動穀が腐敗するという事件が相次いだ。
sen.e: However, in the various provinces, incidents, in which fudokoku became putrid, occurred one after another; it was because the fudoso was kept sealed too long; the warehouses were virtually had been left alone for a long time in spite of the fact that thre was a regulation that says the rice in the husk kept in the fudoso had to be changed regularly (the maximum interval is 9 years) to prevent the putrefaction, this regulation was never observed.

However, in various provinces, incidents, in which fudokoku became putrid, occurred one after another; it was because the fudoso was kept sealed so strictly; the warehouses virtually had been left alone for a long time in spite of the fact that there was a regulation that the rice in the husk kept in the fudoso had to be changed regularly (the maximum interval was 9 years) to prevent the putrefaction.
sen.cmt: 「封印が厳重であった」→"kept sealed too long"を"kept sealed so strictly"に修正。最後のセンテンスは原文にないため不要だと思います。その他文法上の修正をしました。
sen.e: However, in various provinces, incidents, in which fudokoku became putrid, occurred one after another; it was because the fudoso was kept sealed so strictly; the warehouses virtually had been left alone for a long time in spite of the fact that there was a regulation that the rice in the husk kept in the fudoso had to be changed regularly (the maximum interval was 9 years) to prevent the putrefaction.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: このため、天平12年8月14日_(旧暦)（740年）には、一定年限ごとに中身を入れ替えるために太政官符と鑰の交付を受けることが命じられた。
sen.e: For this reason, in August 14 (old calendar) of 740, the order was made to receive the official document issued from the Daijokan and key at regular intervals to change the content of the fudoso.
For this reason, on September 13, 740, the order was made to receive the official document issued by the Daijokan and key at regular intervals to change the content of the fudoso.

sen.e: For this reason, on September 13, 740, the order was made to receive the official document issued by the Daijokan and key at regular intervals to change the content of the fudoso.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この判断自体は正しいものであったが、結果的にこれが不動穀管理の原則を崩す結果となる。
sen.e: This judgment in itself was a right judgment; however, as the result this judgment was to break a principle of Fudokoku management.
This judgment in itself was a right judgment; however, as a result, it was to break the principle of fudokoku management.
sen.cmt: "as the result"→"as a result"に修正。"judgement"が繰り返されるので、最後は"it"にしました。
sen.e: This judgment in itself was a right judgment; however, as a result, it was to break the principle of fudokoku management.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その直後に行われた恭仁京などの遷都計画、東大寺の東大寺盧舎那仏像の造営などで国家財政が悪化すると、地方財源である正税が中央に送られて消費され、これを補うために不動穀の取り崩しが行われた。
sen.e: Right after this order was issued the capital moved to Kuni-Kyo; and along with this transfer of the capital the construction of the statue of Birushana Buddha in Toda-ji Temple adversely affected the financial condition of the Imperial government; because of this weak financial condition, the rice tax, which was the source of local government, was sent to the capital and to supplement the lack of funds, rice in the husk kept in the fudoso came to be taken out gradually.

Right after this order was issued the capital moved to Kuni-Kyo; and along with this transfer of the capital the construction of the statue of Birushana Buddha in Toda-ji Temple adversely affected the financial condition of the Imperial government; because of this weak financial condition, the rice tax, which was the source of local government, was sent to the capital and to supplement the lack of funds, fudokoku came to be taken out gradually.
sen.cmt: 「不動穀」→すでに説明されているので、簡潔に"fudokoku"で良いと思います。
sen.e: Right after this order was issued the capital moved to Kuni-Kyo; and along with this transfer of the capital the construction of the statue of Birushana Buddha in Toda-ji Temple adversely affected the financial condition of the Imperial government; because of this weak financial condition, the rice tax, which was the source of local government, was sent to the capital and to supplement the lack of funds, fudokoku came to be taken out gradually.

sen.j: 一方、中央の朝廷（律令政府）もこれを抑止するどころか、8世紀末期の平安京造営と蝦夷討伐の費用の捻出のために不動穀の一部を中央に上供させたり、不動穀の財源である田租の中から国税にあたる年料租舂米・年料別納租穀を抽出したため、結果的に貯蔵に回す稲穀の量は減少することになった。
sen.e: On the other hand, the central Imperial Court, which was the government based on ritsuryo system, did not suppress this use of rice in the husk in fudoso; the government itself needed funds to build Heiankyo at the end of the eighth century and to send an expedition to subjugate Ezo; so to get expenses for these activities, the government made the rice in the husk from fudoso deliver to the capital; also the government extracted the tax payment in milled rice and nenryo betsu nosokoku, that are the national tax from rice field tax and that is the source of funds for fudo koku; for these reasons, the amount of rice in the husk to be stored was resulted in decrease.

On the other hand, the Imperial Court in the capital, which was the government based on ritsuryo system, did not suppress this use of fudokoku; the government itself needed funds to build Heiankyo (ancient capital in curent Kyoto) at the end of the eighth century and to send an expedition to subjugate Ezo (northerners), so that it ordered a part of fudokoku to be delivered to the capital; also the government extracted the national taxes of nenryo soshomai (milled rice to be provided to officials) and nenryo betsuno sokoku (rice in the husk to be provided to officials) from the rice field tax that should have been stored as fudokoku; it resulted in a decrease in the amount of rice in the husk to be stored.
sen.cmt: 「中央の朝廷」→首都の朝廷。「平安京」「蝦夷」に説明を挿入しました。「不動穀」→すでに説明されているので、簡潔に"fudokoku"で良いと思います。"get expenses"→「費用を得る」で違和感があります。前の文とつなげて修正しました。「年料租舂米・年料別納租穀」→それぞれ官吏に支給した精米・稲穀のこと。政府の財源が不足してくると、この税を取るようになったそうです。（http://homepage3.nifty.com/osuzume/sirabe/kono.htm）web上のwikipediaも参照しました。また、「年料/別納/租穀」という区切りのようです。（http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110002369240）「不動穀の財源である田租の中から」→本来は不動穀となるはずだった田租から、という意味。"A resulted in B"で「AがBの結果をもたらす」なので、主語は"amount"ではなく"it"（前で説明していること）に修正しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Imperial Court in the capital, which was the government based on ritsuryo system, did not suppress this use of fudokoku; the government itself needed funds to build Heiankyo (ancient capital in curent Kyoto) at the end of the eighth century and to send an expedition to subjugate Ezo (northerners), so that it ordered a part of fudokoku to be delivered to the capital; also the government extracted the national taxes of nenryo soshomai (milled rice to be provided to officials) and nenryo betsuno sokoku (rice in the husk to be provided to officials) from the rice field tax that should have been stored as fudokoku; it resulted in a decrease in the amount of rice in the husk to be stored.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: このため、正税及び不動穀のバランスが崩壊して、不動穀は慢性的な流出を続けるようになる。
sen.e: Because of this, the balance of the shozei (the rice tax stored in provintial offices' warehouse) and fudo koku collaped and rice in the husk from fudo koku came to outflow continuously.
Because of this, the balance of the shozei and fudokoku collaped and fudokoku came to outflow continuously.
sen.cmt: 「正税」→既出の文で定義するよう修正したため、ここでは説明は不要。「不動穀」→前文で"fudokoku"（スペースなし）を使用してきたので、統一しました。
sen.e: Because of this, the balance of the shozei and fudokoku collaped and fudokoku came to outflow continuously.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 更にこの仕組みを支えてきた租庸調などの律令制税制・財政も崩壊していったために、不動穀・不動倉の前提である正税・正倉も有名無実化した。
sen.e: Furthermore, So-Yo-Cho tax system and finance that are inseparable with the ritsuryo system had been supporting this mechanism collapsed; therefore, shozei (the rice tax stored in provincial offices warehouse) that are the precondition for fudo koku and fudo warehouse became name only.

Furthermore, So-Yo-Cho tax system and finance of the ritsuryo system that had been supporting this mechanism collapsed; therefore, shozei and shoso that were the preconditions for fudokoku and fudoso became name only.
sen.cmt: 「不動穀」→前文で"fudokoku"（スペースなし）を使用してきたので、統一しました。「不動倉」→"fudoso"で既出。「正税」→既出なので（）内の説明は不要。「正倉」→訳抜けです。
sen.e: Furthermore, So-Yo-Cho tax system and finance of the ritsuryo system that had been supporting this mechanism collapsed; therefore, shozei and shoso that were the preconditions for fudokoku and fudoso became name only.

sen.j: 9世紀末に宇多天皇が譲位に際して書き記した『寛平御遺誡』にも不動穀が廃絶寸前であることが述べられている。
sen.e: The "Kanpyo no Goyuika" is a group of precepts for governing which Emperor Uda wrote at the time of abdication toward the end of the ninth century; this document also mentions that fudokoku is just before extinction.

The "Kanpyo no Goyuikai" is a group of precepts for governing which the Emperor Uda wrote at the time of abdication toward the end of the ninth century; this document also mentions that fudokoku was just before extinction.

sen.e: The "Kanpyo no Goyuikai" is a group of precepts for governing which the Emperor Uda wrote at the time of abdication toward the end of the ninth century; this document also mentions that fudokoku was just before extinction.

sen.j: その後も年料別納租穀の一部停止と不動穀への転用などの再建策が出されたが効果は無く、康保元年（964年）には令制国に対して不動穀の財源を田租に代わる税より賄うとする新委不動穀制（しんいふどうこくせい）が導入されるが、その実施と管理を令制国側に一任したために、現地ではほとんど実施されずに終わったとみられる。
sen.e: Later the Imperial government came up with the reform ideas of stopping a part of the nenryo betsu nosokoku (rice field tax to be kept in the warehouse in provinces to be used when the fund in the capital was scarce) and transfer to fudokoku; however, there was no effect; in 964 a new rule, Shini Fudokokusei, in which source funds are not taken from rice field tax but to take from the new tax was introduced; but the central government left the execution of this new rule and management of fudokoku the officials in provinces; therefore, it seems the new rule came to an end before anything was done.

Later the Imperial government came up with the reform ideas of stopping a part of the nenryo betsuno sokoku and transfering it to fudokoku; however, there was no effect; in 964 a new rule, Shini Fudokokusei was introduced, determining that the source of fudokoku should be a new tax substituting rice field tax, but the central government left the execution and management of this new rule to the officials in provinces; therefore, it seems to have come to an end before anything was done there.
sen.cmt: 「年料別納租穀」→"nenryo betsuno sokoku"という区切りです。既出で説明済み。「不動穀の財源を田租に代わる税より賄うとする新委不動穀制が導入される」部分、分かりやすいように修正しました。他、文法上の修正をしました。
sen.e: Later the Imperial government came up with the reform ideas of stopping a part of the nenryo betsuno sokoku and transfering it to fudokoku; however, there was no effect; in 964 a new rule, Shini Fudokokusei was introduced, determining that the source of fudokoku should be a new tax substituting rice field tax, but the central government left the execution and management of this new rule to the officials in provinces; therefore, it seems to have come to an end before anything was done there.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 11世紀中期の一国平均役によって、朝廷・国衙の事業に必要な経費分だけが徴税される税制に変更されていくと、貯蔵すべき税収の余剰が出る余地も失われたために、不動穀は制度的な根拠を失って事実上消滅してしまったとされている。
sen.e: In the middle of the 11th century Ikkoku heikin yaku (flat rate tax) was introduced and tax system was changed in which the government just imposed for expenses the government need for Imperial court and its provincial offices; with this change the basis of surplus from tax for saving was lost; it is said that with the loss of basis in the tax system, fudokoku was virtually disappeared.

In the middle of the 11th century Ikkoku Heikin Yaku (flat rate tax imposed from time to time) was introduced and tax system was changed so as to collect the tax just to cover the expenses required for the affairs of the Imperial court and its provincial offices; this change removed the possibility of having a tax income surplus to be stored; it is said that due to this loss of basis in the tax system, fudokoku virtually disappeared.
sen.cmt: 「一国平均役」→（必要な分を徴収する）臨時の税であることを説明に入れた方が良いと思います。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E4%B8%80%E5%9B%BD%E5%B9%B3%E5%9D%87%E5%BD%B9）"tax system was changed"以降、分かりやすいように修正しました。その他、文法上の修正をしました。
sen.e: In the middle of the 11th century Ikkoku Heikin Yaku (flat rate tax imposed from time to time) was introduced and tax system was changed so as to collect the tax just to cover the expenses required for the affairs of the Imperial court and its provincial offices; this change removed the possibility of having a tax income surplus to be stored; it is said that due to this loss of basis in the tax system, fudokoku virtually disappeared.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、一説によれば、律令制における田租の原点は、神事の遂行のために在地首長（豪族）へ献上されていた初穂であったとされ、在地首長から政治的・宗教的権限を剥奪した朝廷（律令政府）がその初穂を自己に納めさせたものであり、不動穀化はそれを囲い込むことによって在地首長と田租を切り離す目的があったとも言われている。
sen.e: In addition, according to a view, the starting point of the rice field tax is the first crop of the season offered to the head of a province (powerful local clan) for doing a shrine ritual; the Imperial court which was based on the ritsuryou system took away the political and religious power from the powerful local clan and made the first crop of the season to offer to the court and it is said that the system of fudokoku was to separate the rice field tax from the heads of local provinces.

In addition, according to a view, the starting point of the rice field tax of the ritsuryo system was the first crop of the season offered to the head of a province (powerful local clan) for doing a shrine ritual; the Imperial court which was based on the ritsuryo system took away the political and religious power from the powerful local clan and ordered the first crop of the season to be offered to the court and it is said that the system of fudokoku was to separate the rice field tax from the heads of local provinces.
sen.cmt: 「律令制における」の訳語を挿入。"made the first crop of the season to offer"→文法上の修正をしました。
